etymology.description: 高 + 考 = higher-education entrance exam.
etymology.interpretation: A shorthand for 高等学校招生全国统一考试, literally “higher-education exam.” Refers to China’s national college entrance exam.

parts.english: to examine; to test; to take an exam; to check

examples.chinese: 他正在准备高考(他正在準備高考)。
examples.english: He is preparing for the Gaokao.

examples.chinese: 通过高考，她进入了北京大学(通過高考，她進入了北京大學)。
examples.pinyin: Tōngguò gāokǎo, tā jìnrù le Běijīng Dàxué.
examples.english: Through the Gaokao, she got into Peking University.

examples.chinese: 高考成绩出来后，学生们填报志愿(高考成績出來後，學生們填報志願)。
examples.pinyin: Gāokǎo chéngjì chūlái hòu, xuéshēngmen tiánbào zhìyuàn.
examples.english: After the Gaokao scores come out, students fill in their college preferences.
